creditline: Gift of Gordon Locksley and George T. Shea and the Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
description: five detaching sections of mixed media construction that is painted primarily maroon in center section with embracing couple
text:
Swoon is a street artist who creates life-size woodcut block prints of human figures, often pasting them directly onto abandoned structures throughout the city. Here she brings a fragment of the city into the gallery, breaking the boundary between traditional and street art, by constructing a sculptural canvas from reused materials and wood. 
The two figures are Brooklyn-based poets and fellow street artists Alixa and Naima, collectively known as Climbing PoeTree. Using art and poetry, they seek to overcome the destructive elements of urban life with creativity. With this portrait, Swoon does much the same, honoring the two women as they hold each other—eyes closed and unaware of the viewer—in an intimate moment.
title: Alixa and Naima
